results.title: Daisy: the story of a facelift
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Adam Symansky, Giles Walker and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In a probing yet playful approach to a sensitive subject, this documentary examines the values that prompt people to alter their looks through cosmetic surgery. Personal accounts from men and women, young and old, who have decided to change their bodies are counterbalanced by comments from professionals who explain the effects of physical appearance on our lives. This film focuses mainly on the experiences of Daisy De Bellefeuille, a frank and feisty woman who decides to counter middle age with a facelift. The film provides us with a front-row seat during a facelift operation, as well as a close-up look of the results. (Awards: Melbourne, New York)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubbo, Adam Symansky, Giles Walker and ONF | NFB

results.title: Daisy
results.brief_description: Daisy Duck fine friend of Donald Duck is a keen and enthusiastic dancer. Although having a temper equal to Donald she is able to sooth him and is very good with his three nephews. Daisy can be seen here starring and playing bit parts in these exciting cartoons. There is an introduction by Walt Disney on the development of the Disney characters and the studio. Good family entertainment.

results.title: Daisies = Sedmikrasky [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Vera Chytilova, Ladislav Fikar, Bohumil Smida, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: A modern fable in a stylised setting; the void within the two interchangeable heroines, Marie I and II, bursts forth as a destructive impulse, directed at an indifferent world, in the form of a series of happenings built around particular themes (death, consumption, acting, destruction of meaning). The apparent stylisation in performance, cinematography, sets and music is best understood as subversive of “socialist realism” which, prior to the “New Wave”, had been obligatory in post-war Czech (and East European) cinema. The film was banned for a year and condemned as Dadaist and Brechtian, “at absolute variance with the Marxist-Leninist mission in the arts” as an “official” critic put it. In Czech with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vera Chytilova, Ladislav Fikar, Bohumil Smida, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport and Filmove Studio Barrandov

results.title: Dairyland Romance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Keith Harrison and Jack Keane
results.brief_description:
Story revolves around the importance of choosing breeding partners that have good breeding themselves and the benefits that this will bring their offspring. It stars two cows with human characteristics (standing on two legs, wearing clothes, speaking english, etc.) being interviewed about their successful partnership together and goes on to give information on correct rearing techniques. Hand-painted animation looks suberb and the deadpan delivery of the main charcaters is very amusing.

Illustrated ‘The End’ and opening titles.

results.title: Dairying: space and system
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Meg Stewart, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Geography”.
Questioning the viability of marginal dairy farming this film examines the various factors involved in assessing this industry as a spatial system. It argues the importance of the relationship of the dairy farm with the wider community at different levels, suggests changes which might benefit the industry and community as a whole and finally it asks how long marginal dairy farming can survive.

results.title: Dairying in Australia
results.creator_credit: Lilias Castle, Norman Castle and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of milking, grazing of herds, production of hay, use of silage, production of small crops for farm use, fertilizing of pastures, pasteurization, cheese and butter making and export of dairy products.

results.title: Dairying in Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the work of a typical Victorian dairy farm throughout the year, the bulk handling and processing, distribution and export of dairy products. Filmed on locations at Hunterfield Jersey Stud, Kiewa Milk Supply and Murray Valley Irrigation. Commentary by Roger Climpson.
